1. Demand Forecasting: Boxed likely uses historical sales data and sophisticated analytical tools to predict future demand for its products. This helps them anticipate how much inventory they will need to keep on hand to meet customer demands.

2. Inventory Optimization: Boxed probably uses inventory management software to optimize their inventory levels. This can help them avoid stockouts while also minimizing the amount of money they tie up in inventory.

3. Supplier Relationships: Boxed likely works closely with their suppliers to ensure that they have the products they need when they need them. This involves building strong and collaborative relationships with suppliers, including regular communication and forecasting of future demand.

4. Logistics Management: Boxed probably uses a mix of in-house and third-party logistics providers to make sure that their products are delivered efficiently and cost-effectively.

5. Technology: Boxed may use advanced technologies, such as AI and machine learning, to optimize their supply chain and reduce human error.

One unique factor about Boxed that sets it apart from other retailers is that it focuses on selling bulk items, which means that it needs to manage its inventory and supply chain carefully to avoid overstocking or understocking of its products. Additionally, Boxed's online-only approach may allow it to be more flexible in its supply chain management practices since it does not have physical stores and can adjust inventory levels quickly in response to shifting demand.
